Rodimus and Nightlight are in Blackfortress, Rodimus as Predacona nd Nightl=
igh as prisioner


From: Kraftlos 
Sent: Tuesday, June 02, 2009 11:38 PM
To=
: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
Subject: Re: The Crash Landing and Aftermath




=

OOC: Lord Elder and several other maximals were at the Ark  He called for =
backup and Salveo and his team came to the Ark to help, but had to go back =
to Atlantis when this disaster occurred.  All the Maximals in Atlantis are =
now helping clean up after this storm, then I think Lord Perseus plans to b=
uild a new base somewhere else.

Things got confused when SuperCyclonus lef=
t.  Are Rodimus and Nightlight still with Megatron?



On Tue, Jun 2, 2009 =
at 8:03 PM, <airly2002@...> wrote:




  Soooo

  where are they? I=
 tought that they were in their Base

une 02, 2009 6:58 PM

  city.

  On 5/30/09, airly2002@... <airly2002@hot=
mail.com> wrote:

  >

lty Talon"What about that decepticon

ay 10, 2009 10:36 PM

  > Salveo landed their last =
remaining shuttle atop the metal slab that
  > once was the Maximal Base. T=
he cargo ramp lowered and the crew walked
  > out into the scene of the dis=
aster. They were greeted by Lord Perseus
  > who stopped digging through de=
bris to fill them in on what happened.
  >
  > "Right before the tidal wave=
 hit, we saw a massive ship fly overhead,
  > not 300m above us." he said. =
"Something that massive falling from
  > orbit could easily explain the for=
ce of the water."
  >
  > "How's the rest of the city," asked Salveo.
  >
 =
 > "Not good. Most the people escaped to their shelters, however the
  > bu=
ildings were all destroyed. Except the tower and several on the far
  > sid=
e of the island."
  >
  > "The shuttles?"
  >
  > "Ours was destroyed, a fe=
w were in the air when the wave hit."
  >
  > "I dont think we can rebuild =
this." said Salveo after a moment of
  > looking at the devistation.
  >
  =
> "I think its possible, but unwise. I think this gives us a new
  > opport=
unity to rejoin our Maximal allies and pool our resources. So
  > for the m=
oment, we should recover what we can and put it into the
  > shuttle, then =
assist Atlantis in anyway possible."
  >
  > "Rejoin Lord Elder? Will that =
work? And what about Atlantis?"
  >
  > "Atlantis will be safe from the Uni=
cronians; they wont bother with a
  > few hundred scientists and fisherman.=
 What they want is to destroy
  > us, and they will follow us wherever we d=
ecide to have our base. As
  > for that crashed ship, I dont think its wise=
 to mount a expedition
  > while the city lies in ruin and we remain basele=
ss."
  >
  > "Right, so priority one, help the city and recover what we can=
 from
  > our base." replied Salveo.
  >
  > "Correct."
  >
  > On 4/30/09,=

  >> Lord Pers=
eus opened the door to the lower level of the base, and water
  >> poured i=
nto the room. He motioned for everyone to follow.
  >>
  >> "It looks like =
that ship we saw crash landed in the ocean..." he said
  >> mater of factly=
. "Look at this place."
  >>
  >> What had once been their base was now a s=
lab of concrete and metal
  >> with the ocasional structural support poking=
 up from the foundation.
  >> The city, in just as bad of shape, was errily=
 flat with a large number
  >> of buildings simply washed away.
  >>
  >> "=
Looks like we need a new base." said Guardia steping quietly behind
  >> Lo=
rd Perseus, sloshing water with each step.
  >>
  >> "This base was build f=
rom an old hanger, it wasnt intended to take
  >> that kind of punishment. =
We could rebuild here, or we could find a
  >> better location. First we ne=
ed to make sure the townsfolk are ok;
  >> I'll try to signal Salveo's team=
, we're going to need that shuttle."
  >>
  >> Meanwhile...
  >>
  >> Celer=
on lept up from his chair to stair at some strange radar
  >> readings. An =
entire sector on the map had temporarily darkened, then
  >> went clear aga=
in. The mass that represnted Atlantis didnt look right.
  >> He knew it had=
 changed in the last minion attack; but this didnt even
  >> look like the =
same city anymore.
  >>
  >> "Blast... looks like we need to go see what's =
going on." said Celeron
  >> to himself. "Predecons! Report!"
  >>
  >> OOC=
: This would be the Iron Skull predecon base,
  >>
  >> Meanwhile...
  >>
 =
 >> Salveo walked into the room where Lord Elder was working.
  >>
  >> "At=
lantis was just devastated by a tidal wave. We're going to have to
  >> go =
back there and assist them.; our base was destroyed."
  >>
  >> On 4/24/09,=

  >>> Talon:
  >>>
  =
>>> "WHAT THE PIT IS GOING HERE????" Cursed Talon, in a minion way, while s=
he

  >>> From: Kraftlos

math
  >>>

  >>>
  >>>
  >>>
  >>> The engines had been losing =
power for the last day and a half; but
  >>> finally
  >>> the gigantic cra=
ft could no longer fight the forces that pulled on it and
  >>> its orbit b=
egan to decay. Knowing that their only hope of survival was to
  >>> safely=
 crash land, the pilot picked an open area of ocean and tried to
  >>> appr=
oach at a safe angle to slow itself enough to keep the ship intact.
  >>>
 =
 >>> Lord Perseus and his crew walked along the bridge that crossed the gap=

  >>> between the part of the island where the hangers were located and th=
e
  >>> peninsula area where the base sat. Suddenly the sky became dark and=
 a
  >>> rumbling noise could be heard, growing louder and louder. He looke=
d up to
  >>> see almost the whole sky occupied by a massive starship seeml=
y heading
  >>> straight for the island. The Atlantis emergency alarm start=
ed to sound
  >>> and
  >>> civilians rushed to their shelters.
  >>>
  >>>=
 "Everyone! To the base! Hurry!" ordered Perseus breaking out into a run.
 =
 >>>
  >>> The rumbling sound continued to get louder. As Perseus and his c=
rew
  >>> reached
  >>> the base door, it was quickly opened for them then =
shut behind them. He
  >>> ordered everyone to move the lower level of the =
base. As the ship passed
  >>> over the island, the sound grew so loud that=
 the ground shook and weaker
  >>> parts of buildings started to crumble, a=
s in an earthquake. The ship
  >>> traveled for another three miles before =
it touched down in the deep ocean
  >>> waters. The force of the impact sen=
t the ship hundreds of feet below the
  >>> surface and it continued to sin=
k until coming to rest on the top of an
  >>> underwater mountain. The mass=
 of water displaced by the ship started a
  >>> massive tsunami-like wave, =
going out in all directions.
  >>>
  >>> The ground began to shake again an=
d the lights flickered inside the
  >>> Maximal
  >>> base.
  >>>
  >>> "Si=
r, what's that noise?" Guardia asked, sealing the last heavy door to
  >>> =
the
  >>> underground section of the base.
  >>>
  >>> The lights continued=
 to flicker, then went out.
  >>>
  >>> At that moment the ten-story-high w=
all of water struck Atlantis from the
  >>> east, picking up all the boats =
in the harbor and tossing them onto the
  >>> land.
  >>> The parts of the =
docks that were not made of concrete were pushed up and
  >>> destroyed. A =
moment later the water hit the buildings in the lower wharf
  >>> area and =
they immediately collapsed under the intense weight of water.
  >>> Likewis=
e the metal dome that made up the upper story of the Maximal base
  >>> was=

  >>> immediately ripped from its foundations and carried away, along with=

  >>> everything in the command center, the armory, mess hall, and the mai=
n
  >>> bank
  >>> of CR chambers were also picked up and carried away.
  >=
>>
  >>> The lower floor of the base had a large metal slab to protect it f=
rom
  >>> bombing, and as the water continued to pour over it, everything o=
n the
  >>> upper
  >>> floors was ripped away, leaving a clean plate of me=
tal sitting at the
  >>> bottom
  >>> of the crater that was the base. The =
buildings along the center of the
  >>> town
  >>> were a little sturdier a=
nd remained standing, though heavily damaged. The
  >>> hanger and all the =
craft in it were picked up and thrown into the ocean.
  >>>
  >>> As the wa=
ter came to tower it filled up the deep trench around the
  >>> structure
 =
 >>> then the wall hit it, wrapping it entirely except for the top five
  >=
>> stories,
  >>> damaging supports, breaking out all the windows and destr=
oying the
  >>> bridges
  >>> that allowed access to the tower. The wave th=
en continued across the rest
  >>> of the island, destroying buildings and =
carrying away the mass of debris,
  >>> and then all was eerily quiet.
  >>=
